p: Climate scenarios predict increased temperatures and environmental variability for many regions across the globe [ 1, 2]. These changes are likely to increase species extinction rates [ 3, 4]. Organisms that depend strongly on short windows of rainfall and suitable temperatures to complete their life cycles may be especially vulnerable to climate change. They will be exposed to shortened growing seasons, which impose more stringent time constraints on maturation and reproduction, reduce population growth rates and increase extinction risks [ 5â€“ 7].
